SEARCH

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
UserController
public class UserController extends Object
Controller class for the User Dashboard. Handles borrowing, returning, paying fines, and viewing borrowed items.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zainab

      public UserController()

  • Method Details

    • setCurrentUser

      public void setCurrentUser(String username, String membershipType, String email)
      Sets the current user details and loads their specific data.
      Parameters:
      username - The username.
      membershipType - The membership type (Gold/Silver).
      email - The user's email address.

    • setMembershipType

      public void setMembershipType(String membershipType)
      Sets the membership type and refreshes the view.
      Parameters:
      membershipType - The membership type.

    • setCurrentUsername

      public void setCurrentUsername(String username)
      Sets the username and refreshes the view.
      Parameters:
      username - The username.

    • setCurrentUser

      public void setCurrentUser(String username, String email)
      Sets user credentials (legacy method) and refreshes the view.
      Parameters:
      username - The username.
      email - The email.

    • tryLoadBooks

      private void tryLoadBooks()
      Attempts to load books if user details are present.

    • updateWelcomeLabel

      private void updateWelcomeLabel()
      Updates the welcome label text and style based on membership type.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. Configures table columns, row coloring, and privacy logic (hiding other users' data). Called automatically after the FXML file has been loaded.

    • configureTableColumns

      private void configureTableColumns()
      Configures the TableView columns and binds them to Media properties.

    • configureRowColors

      private void configureRowColors()
      Configures row styling based on the item's status and borrower. Highlights overdue items and borrowed items with specific colors.

    • configureDueDateColumn

      private void configureDueDateColumn()
      Configures the Due Date column to hide dates for items not borrowed by the current user.

    • configureFineColumn

      private void configureFineColumn()
      Configures the Fine column to hide fine amounts for items not borrowed by the current user.

    • isCurrentUserBorrower

      private boolean isCurrentUserBorrower(String borrower)
      Checks if the given borrower username matches the current logged-in user.
      Parameters:
      borrower - The username recorded on the item.
      Returns:
      true if the borrower matches the current user, false otherwise.

    • isBorrowedOrOverdue

      private boolean isBorrowedOrOverdue(String status)
      Checks if the status indicates the item is unavailable (Borrowed or Overdue).
      Parameters:
      status - The status string of the item.
      Returns:
      true if the item is not available.

    • handleLogout

      void handleLogout()
      Handles logout action and redirects to the login screen.

    • handleBorrowBook

      void handleBorrowBook()
      Handles borrowing a book. Checks for existing fines, existing copies, and item availability before processing.

    • handlePayFine

      void handlePayFine()
      Handles fine payment. Validates payment amount, updates the fine status, and returns the book if fine is cleared.

    • handleReturnBook

      void handleReturnBook()
      Handles returning a book. Ensures no fines are pending before returning. If fines exist, notifies the user via email.

    • handleReload

      void handleReload()
      Reloads data from the file and refreshes the table.

    • loadMediaFromFile

      void loadMediaFromFile()
      Loads media data from 'books.txt'. Catches and logs IOExceptions if the file cannot be read.

    • parseMediaLineForUser

      private Media parseMediaLineForUser(String line)
      Parses a single line from the text file for the current user context.
      Parameters:
      line - The CSV formatted string from the file.
      Returns:
      A Media object if parsing is successful, or null if the line is invalid.

    • createMediaItem

      private Media createMediaItem(String type, String title, String author, String isbn, String status, String dueDate, double fine, String borrowedBy, double amountPaid, int copyId)
      Factory method to create a Book or CD based on the type string.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of media ("Book" or "CD").
      title - Title of the item.
      author - Author of the item.
      isbn - ISBN of the item.
      status - Current status (Available, Borrowed, Overdue).
      dueDate - Due date string.
      fine - Current fine amount.
      borrowedBy - Username of the borrower.
      amountPaid - Amount already paid towards fines.
      copyId - The unique copy ID.
      Returns:
      A new instance of Book or CD.

    • applyFineForUserIfOverdue

      private void applyFineForUserIfOverdue(Media item, String borrowedBy)
      Applies the appropriate fine logic if the item is overdue. Uses the current user's membership type if they are the borrower.

    • parseIntSafe

      private int parseIntSafe(String value, int defaultValue)
      Safely parses an integer with a default fallback value.
      Parameters:
      value - The string to parse.
      defaultValue - The value to return if parsing fails.
      Returns:
      The parsed integer or the default value.

    • parseDoubleSafe

      private double parseDoubleSafe(String value, double defaultValue)
      Safely parses a double with a default fallback value.
      Parameters:
      value - The string to parse.
      defaultValue - The value to return if parsing fails.
      Returns:
      The parsed double or the default value.

    • getPart

      private String getPart(String[] parts, int index)
      Safely retrieves an element from a string array.
      Parameters:
      parts - The array of strings.
      index - The index to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The string at the index, or an empty string if out of bounds.

    • normalizeBorrowedBy

      private String normalizeBorrowedBy(String rawBorrowedBy)
      Normalizes the borrowedBy field (converts "0.0" or null to empty string).
      Parameters:
      rawBorrowedBy - The raw string from the file.
      Returns:
      A cleaned username string or empty string.

    • saveAllMediaToFile

      void saveAllMediaToFile()
      Saves all media data to 'books.txt'. Catches IOExceptions if writing fails.

    • reloadBooks

      void reloadBooks()
      Reloads books from file, refreshes the view, and checks for overdue items.

    • checkOverdueAndNotify

      void checkOverdueAndNotify()
      Checks for overdue items belonging to the current user and sends notifications via email.
